macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Dow Jones Closes at Historic 50,000 Milestone
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average surged 2.5% on Friday, February 6, 2026, closing above 50,000 for the first time in history at 50,115.67. The broad-based rally was driven by weak U.S. labor data that intensified expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts, alongside a sharp rebound in semiconductor stocks including Nvidia, Broadcom, and AMD, each surging over 7%.

items.title: S&P 500 and Nasdaq Rally After Tech Selloff
items.summary: The S&P 500 jumped 1.9% and the Nasdaq rose 2.1% on Friday as investors staged a broad-based snapback following a bruising tech-led selloff earlier in the week. Dip buying returned as fears around near-term AI disruption and forced deleveraging eased, with the S&P 500 reaching 6,932 points.

items.title: Market Rotation Shifts from Tech to Traditional Sectors
items.summary: Global markets are experiencing a significant rotation away from mega-cap technology growth stocks toward traditional sectors including Oil & Gas, Industrials, Materials, and Regional Banks. This 'Old Economy' resurgence is driven by more attractive valuations and strengthening industrial cycles amid heightened volatility.

items.title: Nvidia Expected to Beat Q4 Revenue Estimates by $2 Billion
items.summary: Goldman Sachs expects Nvidia to beat Q4 revenue expectations by approximately $2 billion when the company reports earnings on February 25, 2026.

items.title: Ciena Joins S&P 500 with Record Volume
items.summary: Ciena officially joins the S&P 500 on Monday, February 9, 2026, recording its highest volume ever as passive inflows from index funds and institutional investors rebalance to match the new benchmark weighting.

items.title: Solar Sector Stages Strong Bounce
items.summary: Solar stocks including NextEra Energy (NXT), which surged 36% on earnings, led a constructive bounce in the sector. Other performers included Tygo Energy, which broke out of a high-tight flag pattern, alongside Enphase Energy, Corning, and other solar-related names.

items.title: BCA Research Projects Potential 40% S&P 500 Crash
items.summary: BCA Research estimates a 60% probability of recession and has projected the S&P 500 could tumble to between 4,200 and 4,500 points, suggesting a potential 40% crash. Concerns include rising unemployment, sticky inflation, and declining consumer credit quality.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Stabilizes in Mid-$70,000 Range After Recent Correction
items.summary: Bitcoin is trading between $69,394-$72,271, currently at $69,869, down 0.87% over the past 24 hours. The cryptocurrency market cap has rebounded to $2.40 trillion amid buy-the-dip sentiment, with Bitcoin maintaining dominance above 50% of total capitalization.

items.title: Ethereum Faces Selling Pressure Following Vitalik Buterin's Token Sale
items.summary: Ethereum is trading around $2,046.52, down 3.00% in the past 24 hours. Co-founder Vitalik Buterin recently sold approximately 2,800 ETH (worth about $6 million), intensifying short-term selling pressure in an already volatile market.

items.title: Superp Crypto Derivatives Platform Lists on Kraken
items.summary: Superp (SUP), a decentralized exchange allowing leverage trading up to 10,000x, has listed its native token on Kraken. The platform's token outperformed the broader market on listing day despite declines in major cryptocurrencies.

items.title: Tether's Gold Holdings Surpass $23 Billion
items.summary: Tether's gold reserves have exceeded $23 billion, ranking the stablecoin issuer among the top global bullion holders, reflecting growing institutional interest in crypto-backed assets.

items.title: Korean Cryptocurrency Exchange Accidentally Gives Away $60 Billion in Bitcoin
items.summary: A Korean cryptocurrency exchange experienced a significant operational error involving $60 billion in bitcoin, marking a major incident in the digital asset space.

items.title: Ethereum Major Upgrade Scheduled for Mid-2026
items.summary: New technical updates for Ethereum aimed at increasing network throughput and efficiency are planned for mid-year, attracting attention from investors and developers.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Chinese AI Models Dominate 175,000 Exposed Systems Globally
items.summary: A security study by SentinelOne and Censys reveals that Alibaba's Qwen2 has captured the second position in global AI deployment across 175,000 exposed hosts in 130 countries, appearing on 52% of systems running multiple AI models as Western labs face regulatory constraints.

items.title: AI Transforms Data Quality Engineering with Deep Learning and Generative Models
items.summary: Modern AI systems like Sherlock, Jellyfish, and ReClean are revolutionizing data quality by automating column classification, data cleaning, and pipeline optimization, reducing manual intervention and improving data reliability for enterprise systems.

items.title: Generative AI Redefines Payment Systems with Adaptive Authentication
items.summary: GenAI is improving payment processing by enabling adaptive authentication, reducing false declines through better fraud detection, and providing dynamic decision-making that personalizes customer experiences based on behavioral patterns and risk signals.

items.title: AI Brings Predictability to Food Product Development
items.summary: A new review in npj Science of Food demonstrates how machine learning helps food companies predict formulation, processing, and sensory outcomes by analyzing molecular composition, component interactions, and human perception layers.

items.title: AI Safety Report: AI Agents Cannot Execute Autonomous Cyberattacks
items.summary: An international AI safety report confirms that current AI agents cannot independently plan and execute end-to-end cyberattacks without human guidance, providing reassurance on autonomous AI security risks.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield Earns $173 Million in Two Weeks After Launch
items.summary: Hypergryph's Arknights: Endfield has generated over $173 million in revenue across platforms just two weeks post-global launch, marking the first 2026 anime-style game in China to exceed one billion yuan. The title is expanding focus to PC and consoles, achieving 30 million downloads in its first week.[1]

items.title: Incentive Games Partners with Loto-Québec for Real-Money Games Launch
items.summary: Incentive Games announced a partnership with Loto-Québec on February 9, 2026, to launch real-money Crash and Arcade titles in Quebec, Canada, via the Light & Wonder platform. This marks Incentive's entry into the Canadian market with initial titles now live.[5]

items.title: Epic Games Comments on Banned Game 'Horses' by Santa Ragione
items.summary: Epic Games has finally addressed the banning of Santa Ragione's game 'Horses,' which reportedly violated multiple content guidelines. The statement was issued on February 9, 2026.[6]

items.title: Erin Roberts Named Guest of Honour at 3rd Morocco Gaming Expo
items.summary: Veteran game developer Erin Roberts, known for Wing Commander and Star Citizen, will be Guest of Honour at the Morocco Gaming Expo in Rabat from May 20-24, 2026, highlighting Morocco's growing role in global gaming.[7]

items.title: Weekly Top-Selling Steam Games: February 9-15, 2026
items.summary: Counter-Strike 2 leads the top-selling games on Steam for the week of February 9-15, followed by PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS, Nioh 3, Steam Deck, HELLDIVERS 2, ARC Raiders, and Where Winds Meet.[3]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: AutoFlight Flies World's Largest eVTOL Aircraft
items.summary: China’s AutoFlight has successfully flown the first electric vertical-takeoff-and-landing (eVTOL) aircraft in the 5-metric-ton class. The uncrewed Matrix demonstrated full transition between vertical and horizontal flight in a public test.

items.title: EU Launches €700 Million NanoIC Chips Act Pilot Line
items.summary: The European Union has invested €700 million in NanoIC, Europe's largest Chips Act pilot line for semiconductor production. This marks a major step in boosting Europe's chip manufacturing capabilities.

items.title: Tesla Ends Production of Model S and Model X
items.summary: Tesla has ceased production of its Model S and Model X vehicles to shift focus toward robot development. The company aims to prioritize new initiatives amid ongoing autonomous driving developments.

items.title: Australia Releases Major Digital Projects Report 2026
items.summary: The Digital Transformation Agency released its third annual report on 103 major digital projects worth $9.7 billion, showing sustained improvements in delivery confidence and transparency for government digital initiatives.

items.title: Self-Driving Car Incident Near California School
items.summary: A self-driving car struck a child near a California elementary school, raising concerns about autonomous vehicle safety. Details on the specific vehicle and company involved are emerging.
